q:
In data structures, what is the time complexity of the following code:

void func_hack(int m, int n, int mat[r][c])
  int i, k = 0, l = 0
  while (k < m && l < n)
    for i=l to n
	  PRINT mat[k][i]
	   k++;
	for i=k to m 
	  PRINT mat[i][n - 1]
	   n--
	if (k < m) 
	for i=n-1 to l 
	  PRINT mat[m - 1][i]
	   m--
	if (l < n) 
	for i=m-1 to k 
	  PRINT mat[i][l]
	   l++

What is the output of the following C code:

#include <stdio.h>

void main()
{
    int a[][3] = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 120};
    int (*ptr)[5] = a;
    printf("%d %d ", (*ptr)[0], (*ptr)[2]);
    ++ptr;
    printf("%d %d", (*ptr)[1], (*ptr)[3]);
}

In Data Structures, you have executed the following pseudocode to perform an operation with the following input values. Determine x with the respect to the following input values:

Pseudocode

input A,B n*n matrix
output C n*n matrix
define i, j, k
for i from 0 to n
   for j from 0 to n
      C[i,j] = 0
   end for
end for
for i from 0 to n
   for j from 0 to n
      for k from 0 to n
          C[i, j] = C[i, j] + A[i, k] * B[k, j]
      end for
   end for
end for

Input values:

N = 2
A[N][N] = { {1, 2},
            {3, 4}
          }
B[N][N] = { {5, 4},
            {1, 2}
          }

Output

C[N][N] = x

1.

7 19
8 20

2.

8 20
7 19

3.

7 8
19 20

4.

19 20
7 8
